required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Parent-Teen Communication to Resist Unhealthy Media Messages

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this efficacy study is to evaluate how different web-based resources affect parents' and children's sexual health knowledge; attitudes, efficacy, intentions, and behaviors about parent-adolescent communication; attitudes about media messages; and media message deconstruction skills. Parent consumer satisfaction with the resources will also be assessed.

detailed_description.textblock: While the majority of the students will receive sexual education at least once between seventh and twelfth grade, the content that they will receive varies greatly. Thus, adolescents turn to other sources for information about sex including their parents and the media. However, many parents face challenges in being prepared to discuss sex with their adolescent child. While over eighty percent of parents are talking with their children ages 10-18 about issues related to sex, far fewer (60%) discuss more difficult sexual topics such as birth control. These findings suggest that there is a need for evidence-based resources that teach parents the skills needed to have effective conversations with their adolescent children about sexual health topics and media messages that promote early and risky sex.

study_design_info.masking_description: Outcomes Assessor and Care Provider - NA This is a web-based study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in parent reported number of topics included in parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
primary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate if they have ever engaged in parent-child communication on a list of 19 topics related to romantic relationships and sexual health (1. yes; 2. no; 3.didn't discuss but shared information such as a book or online link). Number of topics are summed, and higher numbers represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in child reported number of topics included in parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
primary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate if they have ever engaged in parent-child communication on a list of 19 topics related to romantic relationships and sexual health (1. yes; 2. no; 3.didn't discuss but shared information such as a book or online link). Number of topics are summed, and higher numbers represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in parent reported frequency of parent-child communication about relationships, sex, and media
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
primary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaires ask participants how frequently they engage in parent-child communication about relationships, sex, and media. (1. Never; 2. Rarely; 3. Sometimes; 4. Often). Higher numbers represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in child reported frequency of parent-child communication about relationships, sex, and media
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
primary_outcome.description: Child questionnaires ask participants how frequently they engage in parent-child communication about relationships, sex, and media. (1. Never; 2. Rarely; 3. Sometimes; 4. Often). Higher numbers represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
primary_outcome.description: The child questionnaire includes questions asking participants to self-report if they have ever engaged in any of the following sexual behaviors: oral sex, anal sex, vaginal sex (1. yes; 2. no; 3. not sure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parental perceived importance of parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1 =not at all important - 4=very important) how important they think it is to engage in parent-child communication about several relationship and sexual health topics (e.g., reasons to wait to have sex). Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child perceived importance of parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1 =not at all important - 4=very important) how important they think it is to engage in parent-child communication about several relationship and sexual health topics (e.g., reasons to wait to have sex). Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent level of comfort with parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=not at all comfortable - 4=very comfortable) how comfortable they are engaging in parent-child communication about several relationship and sexual health topics (e.g., reasons to wait to have sex). Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child level of comfort with parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=not at all comfortable - 4=very comfortable) how comfortable they are engaging in parent-child communication about several relationship and sexual health topics (e.g., reasons to wait to have sex). Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent reservations about parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about communicating with their child about sex (e.g., It would embarrass me to talk about sex and birth control with my child). Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child reservations about parent-child communication about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about communicating with their parent about sex (e.g., It would embarrass me to talk about sex and birth control with my parent). Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent outcome expectancies related to communicating with their child about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about the outcomes of communicating with their child about sex (e.g., I will feel proud). Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent self-efficacy to engage in communication with their child about relationship and sexual health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to report on a 7-point scale (1=not sure at all - 7=completely sure) how sure they are that they can explain to their child about several relationship and sexual health topics (e.g., how pregnancy happens). Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent reported parent-child communication quality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements related to parent-child communication (e.g., My child and I can talk about almost anything.) Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child reported parent-child communication quality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements related to parent-child communication (e.g., My parent and I can talk about almost anything.) Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in media deconstruction skills
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: A performance-based measure of media deconstruction skills is included in the parent questionnaire that includes open-ended questions about an alcohol ad. The ad uses sexual themes as a strategy to persuade users to purchase the product. Responses to the open-ended questions will be coded using a reliable and valid coding system of use of media literacy skills.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent skepticism of media messages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about media. Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child skepticism of media messages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about media. Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent perceived realism of media messages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about media. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child perceived realism of media messages
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about media. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent sexual media exposure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=Never - 4=Often) how frequently they consume various media (e.g., Think about your average week. How often do you watch television shows?), and the sexual content of the media they consume (e.g., How would you rate the amount of sexual content in the television shows you watch? No sexual content, A little sexual content, Some sexual content, A lot of sexual content). Lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child sexual media exposure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=Never - 4=Often) how frequently they consume various media (e.g., Think about your average week. How often do you watch television shows?), and the sexual content of the media they consume (e.g., How would you rate the amount of sexual content in the television shows you watch? No sexual content, A little sexual content, Some sexual content, A lot of sexual content). Lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent perception of child's risky online behaviors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 5-point scale (1=Never; 2=Rarely; 3=Sometimes; 4=Often; 5=Always) how often their child has experienced several online situations (e.g., been exposed to sexual content online). Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child risky online behaviors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 5-point scale (1=Never; 2=Rarely; 3=Sometimes; 4=Often; 5=Always) how often they have experienced several online situations (e.g., been exposed to sexual content online). Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child intentions to engage in sexual activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: The child questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale how likely it is that they will engage in sexual activity (e.g., How likely is it that you will have sex before you graduate from high school?) (1=Not likely at all, 2=Unlikely, 3=Likely, 4=Very likely) Participant's responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in willingness to engage in sexual activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: The child questionnaire asks participants to report on a 4-point scale (1=Very unwilling - 4=Very willing) their willingness to engage in sexual activity if they were not sure that they wanted to and their willingness to engage in unprotected sex. Lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent report of parental media mediation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to rate on a 4-point scale (1=Never - 4=Often) how frequently the parent and child engage in several behaviors related to media use and rules. Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child report of parental media mediation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to rate on a 4-point scale (1=Never - 4=Often) how frequently the parent and child engage in several behaviors related to media use and rules.Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent sexual health knowledge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire includes several knowledge-based questions (true/false; multiple choice) to assess sexual health knowledge. Participant's correct responses will be summed, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child sexual health knowledge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire includes several knowledge-based questions (true/false; multiple choice) to assess sexual health knowledge. Participant's correct responses will be summed, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent attitudes about teen sex
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about teen sex. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child attitudes about teen sex
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about teen sex. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sexual abstinence self-efficacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements related to abstaining from sexual activity. Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Contraception self-efficacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements related to contraception. Item responses will be averaged, and higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Parent change in acceptance of strict gender role norms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about gender roles. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Child change in acceptance of strict gender role norms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about gender roles. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent acceptance of rape myths
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about rape. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child acceptance of rape myths
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about rape. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parent acceptance of dating violence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about dating violence. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in child acceptance of dating violence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1) pretest questionnaire; 2) posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest; 3) follow-up questionnaire - 24 weeks after pretest
secondary_outcome.description: Child questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree with several statements about dating violence. Item responses will be averaged, and lower values represent a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: Intervention parent posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest
other_outcome.description: The intervention parent questionnaire asks participants to indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how likely they would be to recommend the program to other parents.

other_outcome.measure: Liked most and least about program
other_outcome.time_frame: Intervention parent posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest
other_outcome.description: The intervention parent questionnaire asks participants what they liked most and least about the program (open-ended).

other_outcome.time_frame: Intervention parent posttest questionnaire - 4 weeks after pretest
other_outcome.description: The intervention parent questionnaire asks participants indicate on a 4-point scale (1=Strongly disagree - 4=Strongly agree) how much they agree that the program was more helpful, more comprehensive, and easier to use than other programs.

arm_group.description: Web-based resource on adolescent sexual health
Alternate web-based resource on adolescent sexual health

intervention.intervention_name: Web-based resource on adolescent sexual health
intervention.description: Web-based resource on adolescent sexual health than the intervention.

intervention.intervention_name: Alternate web-based resource on adolescent sexual health
intervention.description: This is a different web-based resource on adolescent sexual health than the intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- parent or legal guardian of a child in 7th, 8th, or 9th grade
Exclusion Criteria:
- not fluent in English
- does not have access to internet to complete study tasks
